png

Class PngMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.PngMetadata
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetadataStrategy<PngDirectory>, java.lang.Iterable<PngDirectory>, PngMetadataStrategy

    public class PngMetadata
extends java.lang.Object
implements PngMetadataStrategy
    Implements the PngMetadataStrategy interface to provide a comprehensive view and extraction capability for metadata embedded within a PNG file. This class aggregates various PNG chunk directories, managing and prioritising embedded metadata standards like EXIF and XMP for accurate data extraction.

    It organises metadata into directories based on chunk category, for example: TEXTUAL, MISC, etc and pro-actively parses embedded XMP data if an iTXt chunk is detected.

    Since:
    12 November 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

        Specified by:
        getXmpDirectory in interface PngMetadataStrategy
        Returns:

      • hasXmpData

        public boolean hasXmpData()
        Checks if the metadata contains an XMP directory. Note, XMP data is typically embedded in an iTXt chunk.
        Specified by:
        hasXmpData in interface MetadataStrategy<PngDirectory>
        Returns:
        true if XMP metadata is present and non-empty, otherwise false

      • extractDate

        public java.util.Date extractDate()

        Extracts the date from PNG metadata following a priority hierarchy:

        1. Embedded EXIF data (most accurate, from DateTimeOriginal)
        2. Embedded XMP data (reliable fallback, from CreateDate or DateTimeOriginal)
        3. Generic Textual data with the 'Creation Time' keyword (final fallback)
        Specified by:
        extractDate in interface MetadataStrategy<PngDirectory>
        Returns:
        a Date object extracted from one of the metadata segments, otherwise null if not found

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates a string representation of the PNG metadata, listing all categories and their associated directory contents.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a formatted string containing all metadata details
